Description: Papyrus with two registers of figures, including fowling scenes, but partly left empty. Magical/medical text on reverse.
Curator's comments: A. Klasens, A magical statue base (socle Behague) in the Museum of Antiquities at Leiden, OMRO 33, Leiden 1952, 9-20 M. Vandenbeusch, 'Evidence of an ancient archive? The papyrus British Museum EA 9961', JEA 104 (2), 177-194
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (381244) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/381244)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: scotch magic tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A
